attributes.action: Stop telecommunications companies overcharging for services
attributes.additional_details:
For decades telephone companies have been charging customers for setting-up calls (as if this were done manually) even though exchanges are automated and computerised. Likewise some charge for caller ID and for returning a call along with other features which cost very little to provide.
Many of these charges are unreasonable.
BT's charges are a typical example https://www.productsandservices.bt.com/products/lib/pdf/BT_PhoneTariff_Residential.pdf
attributes.background:
Charges such as call set-up, caller ID display and call return cost companies little or nothing to provide yet customers have to pay.
BT, for example, charge £1.75 per month for caller display, 19p call set-up, and 26.5p call return

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. It's clear that you're concerned about telecoms charges, but it's not clear what action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could ask Parliament to set a maximum level for these charges in law.
